fields_of_interest: Economy, finance and the euro, Culture and media, Competition, Regional Policy, Research and innovation, Trans-European Networks, Digital economy and society, Communication
eu_initiatives: Review of Copyright Directive is key issue at current time. Direct responses to public consultations. Support other organisations, including members, to provide representations or evidence on points of issue.
organisation_name: Association of Learned and Professional Society Publishers (ALPSP)
section: II - In-house lobbyists and trade/business/professional associations
membership: Member of the British Copyright Council
relevant_communication: Discussion of latest policies with Copyright Committee. Preparation and dissemination of member briefings and updates explaining the latest policies with implications for member organisations. Obtaining feedback from members on particular issues to prepare consultation responses on their behalf.
goals__remit:
The Association of Learned and Professional Society Publishers (ALPSP) is the international membership trade body which works to support and represent not-for-profit organisations and institutions that publish scholarly and professional content around the world.  Its membership also encompasses those that partner with and provide services to not-for-profit publishers.   
 
ALPSP has over 300 members in 40 countries, who collectively publish over half the world’s total active journals as well as books, databases and other products.
